evidences.text: The Symbolism of Ganesha God Every aspect of Ganesha’s form carries profound symbolism. His elephant head represents Atman (the soul), which is the ultimate supreme reality of human existence, and his human body signifies Maya (the earthly existence of human beings). Ganesha’s large ears remind him to listen more and absorb more wisdom, while his small eyes symbolize concentration.

In June 2014, the Great Himalayan National Park was added to the UNESCO list of World Heritage Sites , [1] under the criterion of "outstanding significance for biodiversity conservation". evidences.text: Brothers Khodayar and Hormazdiar Kayani migrated to Pune from Iran and launched the eponymous bakery in the city's Camp area way back in 1955. Over the years, the iconic bakery is synonymous with the Shrewsbury biscuit, a buttery creation that's Kayani's signature offering. advertisement Vintage Charm Marble floors, a few wooden chairs, a counter with glass display over which they deftly wrap your order and a blackboard that announces the menu and rates ensure that the bakery retrains its old world vintage charm. Photograph by Bhaskar Paul On the Blackboard Even as visitors throng the bakery for the Shrewsbury biscuits, regulars come in for fresh warm bread, soft mawa cakes, khari, nankatai and cakes.
